## Our Dataset

We have **Grit Scale data** from university students:

| Variable | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `ID` | Participant ID |
| `Age`, `Gender` | Demographics |
| `Study_Year` | First Year (1) or Final Year (2) |
| `G1`-`G8` | Grit Scale items (1-5 scale) |

---

## Loading Packages

In RStudio Server, you'll use `read_csv()` from the `readr` package. For WebR slides, we use base R's `read.csv()` for better compatibility.

::: {.callout-note}
## Note for RStudio

In your RStudio notebook, use `read_csv()` from `readr` - it's faster and creates tidier output. The slides use `read.csv()` because it works more reliably in WebR.
:::

---

## Loading from a URL

Data can be loaded directly from the internet. For WebR, we'll use base R's `read.csv()`:

```{webr-r}
# The URL where our data lives
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"

# Load it! (Using base R for WebR compatibility)
data <- read.csv(data_url, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

---

## Inspecting: head()

`head()` shows the first few rows:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"
data <- read.csv(data_url, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

head(data)
```

---

## Inspecting: str()

`str()` shows the **structure** - column names and types:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"
data <- read.csv(data_url, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

str(data)
```

---

## Inspecting: dim()

`dim()` tells you **rows** and **columns**:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"
data <- read.csv(data_url, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

dim(data)
```

How many participants? How many variables?

---

## Accessing Columns

Use `$` to access a single column:

```{webr-r}
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"
data <- read.csv(data_url, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Access the Study_Year column
data$Study_Year
```

---

## Common Error: Function Not Found

```r
read_csv("data.csv")
```

```
Error: could not find function "read_csv"
```

**Fix:** Load the package first!

```{webr-r}
library(readr)  # Load the package
# Now read_csv() works
```
